intro: Cerastium africanum, commonly known as African mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cerastium africanum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
